CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. A18 reads: "Planning For Fall - Shown discussing the fall sales program for Seagram Distributing Company are: Bob French [Frank Cepits], left, sales representative of Seagram's Western Pennsylvania area, and Assistant State Manager Frank Cepits [Bob French]. This type of planing throughout the Seagram Company has helped to make Seven-Crown the largest selling whiskey in country; Seagram's V.O., the second largest; and Seagram's Gin, their other product, one of the steadiest gaining sales products of its type. - Harris photo"
TitMainTitle: Regional sales manager Frank Cepits, and sales representative Robert "Bob" P. French Jr., seated behind desk in office interior with geometric patterned curtains
